title: Incorrect arch-specfic optimization flags used in mixed toolchain

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Add a mixed toolchain compiler using clang for C/CXX and IBM XL for Fortran
2. Install a package that uses Fortran:
```console
$ spack install superlu-dist%<that_mixed_toolchain_name>
```

### Error Message
In the case of a mixed toolchain, (e.g., clang for C/CXX but XL for Fortran), no architecture-specific optimization flags should be used as Spack does not currently support them.  Instead, `SPACK_TARGET_ARGS` (environment variable) contains `-mtune` and `-mcpu` flags that cause the XL Fortran compiler to fail (as they are not valid flags for that compiler):
```
xlf2003_r: 1501-216 (W) command option -mcpu=power9 is not recognized - passed to ld
xlf2003_r: 1501-216 (W) command option -mtune=power9 is not recognized - passed to ld
ld: unrecognised emulation mode: tune=power9
Supported emulations: elf64lppc elf32ppc elf32ppclinux elf32ppcsim elf32lppc elf32lppclinux elf32lppcsim elf64ppc elf32_spu
gmake[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/cmTC_908ba.dir/build.make:87: cmTC_908ba] Error 1

```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
* **Spack:** 0.15.4
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-power9le

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information
The [mixed toolchain detection logic](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py#L198-L204) is skipped when a `CompilerSpec` object is passed in, in which case incorrect optimization flags are returned,
